016
017package imagingbook.parboiled.matchers;
018
019import imagingbook.parboiled.MatcherContext;
020import imagingbook.parboiled.Rule;
021import imagingbook.parboiled.errors.GrammarException;
022import imagingbook.parboiled.matchervisitors.MatcherVisitor;
023
024import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkArgNotNull;
025
026/**
027 * A {@link Matcher} that repeatedly tries its submatcher against the input.
028 * Succeeds if its submatcher succeeds at least once.
029 */
030public class OneOrMoreMatcher extends CustomDefaultLabelMatcher<OneOrMoreMatcher> {
031    public final Matcher subMatcher;
032
033    public OneOrMoreMatcher(Rule subRule) {
034        super(checkArgNotNull(subRule, "subRule"), "OneOrMore");
035        this.subMatcher = getChildren().get(0);
036    }
037
038    public boolean match(MatcherContext context) {
039        boolean matched = subMatcher.getSubContext(context).runMatcher();
040        if (!matched) return false;
041
042        // collect all further matches as well
043        int lastIndex = context.getCurrentIndex();
044        while (subMatcher.getSubContext(context).runMatcher()) {
045            int currentIndex = context.getCurrentIndex();
046            if (currentIndex == lastIndex) {
047                throw new GrammarException("The inner rule of OneOrMore rule '%s' must not allow empty matches",
048                        context.getPath());
049            }
050            lastIndex = currentIndex;
051        }
052
053        context.createNode();
054        return true;
055    }
056
057    public <R> R accept(MatcherVisitor<R> visitor) {
058        checkArgNotNull(visitor, "visitor");
059        return visitor.visit(this);
060    }
061}
